email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. We have a vessel available for a crude oil shipment from Rotterdam to Singapore. The vessel is the MV Ocean Star, 150,000 DWT, 280m LOA. The laycan is 15-20 October. Starting freight quote is in the low 50s, USD 50.75 per ton. Let me know if this works for you or if you need further details. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the details. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit high. Can you come down to USD 49.50 per ton? Also, could you confirm the vessel's draft and any restrictions at the discharge port? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your response. I can offer USD 50.00 per ton, which is competitive given the current market. The vessel's draft is 18.5m, and there are no restrictions at Singapore port. Let me know if this works. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the update. We can agree to USD 50.00 per ton. Can we also confirm the demurrage rate? We’d like it capped at USD 25,000 per day. Let me know if this is acceptable. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, USD 25,000 per day for demurrage is acceptable. I’ll draft the charter party agreement with these terms. Please confirm the cargo size is 140,000 MT, and the incoterm is CFR Singapore. Let me know if there’s anything else. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, everything looks good. Cargo size is confirmed at 140,000 MT, and CFR Singapore is correct. Please proceed with the charter party agreement. Thanks for your help! Best, John
